properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 9:15AM CST until January 18 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Grand Forks ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed light snow and freezing drizzle this morning
becoming snow this afternoon into Saturday morning. Total snow
accumulation 3 to 5 inches. Southeast winds gusting over 50 mph
today becoming northwest to 55 mph overnight into Saturday.

* WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota and
southeast North Dakota.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 2 AM CST Saturday.
For the Blizzard Warning, from 2 AM to 6 PM CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as
low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in
as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at
dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling
5 1 1 in either state.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CST SATURDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY
